title: Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 to go on sale today on Flipkart & Mi.com: Find out the time, features & specs
text:
Technology Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 to go on sale today on Flipkart & Mi.com: Find out the time, features & specs Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 to go on sale today on Flipkart & Mi.com: Find out the time, features & specs Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi's latest smartphone, the Redmi Note 4 will go on sale today, on Flipkart as well as Xiaomi’s own India store Mi.com. By: FE Online | Published: February 22, 2017 11:42 AM Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 was launched in January this year and it was the company’s first device in the country in 2017. The Redmi Note 4 will be available in two options, in terms of storage- while the base variant is of 2GB and 32GB internal memory will cost users an amount of Rs 9,999, the other variant of 4GB and 64GB will come for a price of Rs 12,999. 
Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi ’s latest smartphone, the Redmi Note 4 will go on sale today, on Flipkart as well as Xiaomi’s own India store Mi.com. The sale will start from 12 PM on both the e-tailing platforms. Xiaomi seems to be going all out to capture the Indian smartphone market, especially evident from the fact that the company just made India’s Manu Kumar Jain as the vice president of the company. Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 was launched in January this year and it was the company’s first device in the country in 2017. The Redmi Note 4 will be available in two options, in terms of storage- while the base variant is of 2GB and 32GB internal memory will cost users an amount of Rs 9,999, the other variant of 4GB and 64GB will come for a price of Rs 12,999. If you want to buy the smartphone, you need to be really quick as the devices get sold out within minutes of their launch. The smartphone earlier went on sale on the e-commerce websites, twice in January and once in early February, and it became an instant hit and sold out lakhs of devices, as claimed by Xiaomi. 
Xiaomi had introduced a different colour variant, that is matte black. According to new reports, this model will be available from March 1.There is no data on the available on the number of units Xiaomi will be selling today, in the flash sale. Yet, the way people have responded to the smartphone in earlier sales, it won’t be surprising if this time too the device gets sold out within minutes. Earlier the device was only available in grey and gold colour bodies. As far as the specifications are concerned, Xiaomi has stayed true to its bigger battery promise, as the new device comes with a big 4100 mAh battery and the company claimed it to be 25 percent better than the erstwhile Redmi Note 3. The device is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 625 processor, which uses the new 14nm FinFET technology. 
According to Flipkart, in its January 23 sale, it sold around 2 lakh Redmi Note 4’s within a few minutes. In 2016, the last smartphone by Xiaomi called the Redmi Note 3, became highly popular in India and also became the highest selling smartphone. Xiaomi had also reportedly crossed a revenue of $1 billion and was ranked as number 3 smartphone vendor in the country. The hugely anticipated Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 device was unveiled in China in 2016 and it came in two storage variants, the 2GB RAM and 16GB inbuilt storage model, and the 3GB RAM and 64GB inbuilt storage version. 
Also read | Xiaomi Redmi Note 4: Why & why not to buy the latest smartphone 
Apart from the metal build of the handset, the novel feature that the Redmi Note 4 has is that it supports USB Type-C port. It is Xiaomi’s first smartphone to have the new reversible slot. The new smartphone runs Xiaomi’s latest MIUI 8 based on Android 6.0 Marshmallow and is powered by a deca-core MediaTek Helio X20 coupled with Mali-T880 MP4 GPU, which is expected to improve performance and reduce battery consumption. The Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 has a display of 5.5-inch full-HD (1080×1920 pixels) with 2.5D curved glass and 401ppi pixel density. Both the variants of the storage capacity of 2GB and 3GB RAM models can have expandable storage via microSD card (maximum of 128GB). 
Also read | Xiaomi Redmi Note 4X with 4100 mAh battery & Snapdragon 625 launched; specs & features 
Redmi Note 4 contains a hybrid type of SIM slot which lets users the options of going with a combination of either dual-SIM cards or one Micro-SIM and one microSD card. With the feature of PDAF (phase detection autofocus), the phone has a 13-megapixel rear camera and the option of f/2.0 aperture. It can record 1080p videos at 30fps. The front camera of 5-megapixels, which according to Xiaomi, can click wide angle shots extended to 85-degrees. Note 4 comes with fingerprint scanner placed on the back panel right below the primary camera. It also has a dual-tone LED flash. Interestingly there is also an infrared sensor in the Redmi Note 4. 
Usual connectivity options are already present, like GPRS/ EDGE, 3G, 4G with VoLTE, Bluetooth, GPS, and GLONASS. Note 4 dimensions are 151x76x8.35mm with a weight of 175 gms. Please Wait while comments are loading...
